feed.title: Re: Discover
feed.subtitle: In this little corner of the web I share thoughts, logs, notes, and projects, rediscovering my love for tech, writing, games, anime, manga, and tinkering in the process!

entry.title: Compartmentalizing my Digital Life
entry.summary: I realized that if I want to stick to healthier habits, I should remove any barriers that prevent me from executing them. So I have divided certain tasks and activities between all of my devices, starting with...

entry.title: Give Evening Pages a Try!
entry.summary: Writing can be hard and sometimes almost nigh impossible; it is something you have to be in the right mindset for. For me, I don't have trouble staying motivated once I start; I can stay in the flow state for long periods of time. My problem more so comes from starting.

entry.title: Has It Been Two Years Already?

link.title: Has It Been Two Years Already?

entry.summary: Yes, apparently so! I'm still flabbergasted, but dates don't lie, do they? It has been two years since the start of this digital garden, formerly a blog, all the way back to my first post in March 2023. Wild!

entry.title: Revamping my Backlog
entry.summary: I've been quite happy with my backlog since I added it back in January, but now I'm closing in on the middle of the year. I like to rework it a little. The page itself won't change much, but in the spirit of transitioning to a digital garden, I'm adding dedicated pages to each entry in the log. Where I can have notes, summaries, and screenshots all in one place for media. Like a commonplace boo...

entry.title: Taking Inkdown for a Spin!
entry.summary: I decided to go back to Markdown for all my notes. I use VS Code as my Markdown editor of choice for writing these posts and taking notes, but I recently learned about a new Markdown notetaking app that caught my interest, so I've decided to take it for a spin!
